alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wake; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 8:44AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Johnston, Wake and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated isolated showers and thunderstorms across the Advisory area. While showers have weakened at the moment, another round of rainfall may develop as a cold front moves through the Triangle between 9 AM and 11 AM. This could lead to additional flooding across the region. Also, runoff from earlier rainfall is causing rises on numerous creeks and streams across the Triangle resulting in flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Clayton, RDU International, Apex, Morrisville, Knightdale, Selma, Wendell, Lake Benson, Flowers, Lake Wheeler, Emit, William B Umstead State Park, Research Triangle, Buckhorn Reservoir and Carpenter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
